required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sonographic Assessment for Prediction of Labor Induction Success
clinical_study.official_title: Sonographic Assessment of Fetal Head Circumference, Cervical Length and Fetal Head to Cervix Angle for Prediction of Labor Induction Success

brief_summary.textblock: The study is conducted to assess several sonographic parameters for prediction of labor induction success. These parameters include cervical length, fetal head circumference, and fetal head to cervix angle.

detailed_description.textblock:
Pregnant women at term over 37 weeks` gestation visiting the obstetric emergency room for various obstetric indications will be assessed. Women with obstetric or medical indication for induction will receive an explanation regarding the study protocol and will sign an informed consent.
After recruitment and during the evaluation in the obstetric emergency room, patients will undergo transvaginal sonography during which, cervical length, fetal head circumference and fetal head to cervix angle will be measured.
Relevant demographic and obstetric information will be collected from a computerized database.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the obstetric emergency room up to 24 hours postpartum
primary_outcome.description: Vaginal delivery rate after labor induction

clinical_study.condition: Induction of Labor Affected Fetus / Newborn

intervention.description: Transvaginal sonography for measurement of cervical length, fetal head circumference and fetal head to cervix angle .

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women with singleton pregnancy over 37 weeks` gestation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Singleton pregnancy.
- Term pregnancy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiple gestation.
- Fetal anomalies and malformations.
- Preterm pregnancy.
